message: I'll start: Goodbye competition, goodbye cheap calling plans hello more consumer abuse
Another decent customer service going to the Dogs,(Cingular)
Maybe some better coverage outside of the cities.  I've been hoping AT&T would merge with someone to help fill in their gaps in coverage.  I'll be curious to see if it does so.

I've been a happy T-Mobile customer for about ten years and an AT&T customer since the first iPhone. When my AT&T phone will not dial out or drops calls I can always fall back on my reliable T-Mobile line.

Another example: AT&T wants $19.99/month *per line* for unlimited text messages. T-Mobile has given unlimited text messages on every line in our family share plan for $9.99. At four lines that's a savings of ~$70 per month plus tax on text messages alone.
Yes. I'd like to see the government block this but given the track record of late...
If you call and complain: no service for you. Wait I never had service.
I thought Sprint and T-Mobile were planning to merge. Wonder what made Sprint pull out of the deal.
AT&T needs a better network not more customers to overload their system even more
One good thing about not being in the United States
Sprint didnt pull out, they are trying to block it they still want t-mobile
I think Verizon needs to buy Sprint
I hope that this will actually improve my phone service
Just another example of corpate greed.
i also heard that tmobile customers will have to get new phones, but that should be a given

if the deal goes through att will have better service... if sprint gets it then it will kickstart their lte 4g (real 4g)... their wimax w/ clearwire isnt exactly 4g but closer to it than what att/tmobile has.. tech wise.. speed wise i think HSPA+ is faster but is still a 3g tech

on another note if att buys tmobile some think that verizon will buy sprint because they will be smaller but others say they wont because they dont want issues w/ the govt.. sprints stocks have dropped so this is already bad for the company (which has had $$$ problems) and the subscribers

If ATT and TMobile no reason not to have Verizon Sprint. Watch for that next. They do it even if halfhearted so as to prove to regulators that TMobile ATT shouldn't happen. Verizon will be afraid of someone else buying Sprint.
I think that the bad is now consuming the worse.  I'm happy to be a Verizon customer.
verizon is awesome, i just dont like their pricing.. but i do get 25% my sprint bill every month so....
New #1 carrier doesn't care if you can make calls.
@rpolak AT&T has unlimited texting on family plans for $30.
hopefully ATT reception will improve a bit more now
